intro: Galium elegans var. nephrostigmaticum, commonly known as the nephrostigmatic bedstraw, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
